intro: Crepidorhopalon manganicola, commonly known as the manganese-bearing liverwort, is a type of non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves that are often clustered in dense, cushion-like growths. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in rocky or soil-covered areas. It is notable for its ability to absorb manganese from its surroundings, which contributes to its unique chemical composition. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is often considered a rare and specialized species.
